family.notes: 儿 (child) + 子 (child/son). Uses both child characters together for emphasis.
Pictograph of a person with an open fontanelle (soft spot on baby's head), representing an infant.
Pictograph of a swaddled baby. One of the most common character components in Chinese.
Pictograph of a kneeling woman with crossed arms. A fundamental radical in many characters.
Reduplication of 妈 (ma). The character contains 女 (woman) + 马 (horse) as phonetic component.
Reduplication of 爸 (ba). Contains 父 (father) + 巴 as phonetic component.
老 (old/dear) + 公 (male). Informal/affectionate term for husband.
老 (old/dear) + 婆 (woman). Informal/affectionate term for wife.

numbers.notes: Simple representation: two horizontal lines for the number 2.
Complex character combining phonetic 娄 (lóu) with 攵 (action radical). The action radical suggests counting/tapping.

education.notes: Contains 子 (child) at the bottom. Represents hands teaching knowledge to a child under a roof.
数 (number) + 学 (study). Literally 'number study' = mathematics.
老 (old/respected) + 师 (master). A 'respected master' = teacher.
中 (middle) + 学生 (student). A student in middle/high school.
大 (big) + 学生 (student). A university/college student.

professions.notes: 医 (medicine) + 生 (life). One who deals with life/healing.
律 (law) + 师 (master). A 'law master' = lawyer.
Used as a suffix for many professions: 厨师 (chef), 工程师 (engineer), 设计师 (designer).

medicine.notes: Simplified from 醫. Originally showed arrows in a quiver (treating arrow wounds) and a wine vessel (for sterilization).

countries.notes: 美 (beautiful) + 国 (country). Phonetic translation of 'America'.
日 (sun) + 本 (origin). 'Origin of the sun' - Japan is east of China where the sun rises.
Simplified from 國. Shows 玉 (jade/treasure) inside 囗 (enclosure) - protecting what's valuable.

basic_words.notes: The main verb 'to be' in Chinese. One of the most common characters.
这 (this) + 是 (is). Used to introduce or point to something.
Pictograph of a person walking. One of the most fundamental characters in Chinese.
Negation word. Tone changes to 2nd tone before 4th tone words.

food_and_drink.notes: 米 (rice grain) + 饭 (meal/food). Specifically refers to cooked rice.
饭 (meal) + 馆 (building/hall). A place to eat meals.
Pictograph of flowing water. One of the most common radicals in Chinese.
Contains 艹 (grass radical) on top, indicating it's a plant. Tea originated in China.

adjectives.notes: Simplified from 熱. Contains 火 (fire) at the bottom, indicating heat.
Pictograph of a person with arms spread wide to show size.
Shows a line through the center of a rectangle, indicating the middle.

adverbs.notes: Reduplication of 常 (often). Emphasizes frequency of action.

common_components.notes: Pictograph of a plant sprouting from the ground. Core meaning: life, birth, to grow. Used in many compound words.
Shows an elderly person with long hair and a cane. Conveys both age and respect.
Contains 彳(step radical) suggesting regulated movement/behavior, and 聿 (writing brush) for written rules.
